Steps illustrating the injection protocol. (A) On the left are 2-days-post-fertilization zebrafish in a small petri dish containing an anesthetizing solution (tricaine). A Pasteur pipette can be seen on top for moving the zebrafish from the petri dish onto the agarose mold. On the right is an agarose mold (placed on an inverted lid of a petri dish) and a hair loop manipulator. (B) An agarose mold with zebrafish aligned in the rightmost channel.(C) Breaking off the needle with fine tweezers using a stereomicroscope. The needle is held by a micromanipulator. (D) Injecting zebrafish using a stereomicroscope and a micromanipulator holding a glass needle. materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"4dtvu","text":"All media were purchased from Sigma Aldrich, Switzerland unless indicated otherwise. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22kgd","text":"All experiments in this study were conducted using lysogeny broth (LB).  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1ec2","text":"Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmcq2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enkem","text":"For this protocol, you will need the following equipment: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l3t3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dhlm","text":"An incubator set to 37°C at 170 rpm with aeration (e.g., Infors, Multitron Standard Shaker) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s8v7","text":"A spectrophotometer to measure optical density at a wavelength of 600 nm ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daqsl","text":"A centrifuge similar to MPW Med. steps.section: Part 3: Zebrafish infections into the otic vesicle (2 dpf)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"61r5u","text":"Determine the desired drop size by injecting drops into the oil and adjusting either the injection time (to between  - ) or injection pressure (to between 200-400 hPa). In case the solution in the needle gets aspirated back in or leaks, adjust the injection back pressure (to between 20-30 hPa). At a magnification of 56X, a drop that has the diameter of five stripes on the ruler corresponds to a volume of 1 nL. This can be determined because the liquid to inject will be a perfect sphere within the oil.
